meanings.def: having a desire to cause physical or mental pain and make somebody suffer
examples: He was known to be a cruel dictator.
cruel to somebody/something I can't stand people who are cruel to animals.
Her eyes were cruel and hard.
Sometimes you have to be cruel to be kind (= make somebody suffer because it will be good for them later).

meanings.def: causing physical or mental pain and making somebody suffer
examples: It was a cruel irony that he, being gravely ill, would survive his family.
It would be a cruel twist of fate if he escaped only to starve to death once outside.
Her father's death was a cruel blow.

meanings.def: a category of very severe punishment that is banned under US law
examples: This important case confronts the issue of what constitutes cruel and unusual punishment.
Detainees are subjected to malnutrition, forced labor, and to other cruel and unusual punishments.

idioms.def: a category of very severe punishment that is banned under US law
examples: This important case confronts the issue of what constitutes cruel and unusual punishment.
Detainees are subjected to malnutrition, forced labor, and to other cruel and unusual punishments.

meanings.def: to negatively affect an opportunity or a chance of success
examples: He cruelled his interview by arriving late and being completely unprepared.
A back injury cruelled her chances in the final.
